items.q: What is tariff.ai and how does it save me money?
items.a: tariff.ai is an AI-powered platform that analyzes tariffs, duties, and trade regulations across 190+ countries. It saves you money by identifying the most cost-effective classification codes, alerting you to available trade agreements, and preventing costly compliance errors.

items.q: How accurate is the HS code classification?
items.a: Our AI achieves 98% accuracy in HS code classification, verified against official customs databases. Each classification includes a confidence score and detailed reasoning, so you can verify the logic behind every recommendation.

items.q: Does the system consider Free Trade Agreements (FTAs)?
items.a: Absolutely. tariff.ai automatically identifies tax-saving opportunities based on trade agreements between countries (like Israel-Europe or US agreements), and indicates which documents are required to claim the duty exemption.

items.q: How frequently is the data updated?
items.a: Our database is updated in real-time with direct connections to government databases in 190+ countries. You'll always have access to the latest tariff rates and regulatory changes.

items.q: Can the system be integrated into our corporate ERP?
items.a: Yes, we offer API access for enterprise customers, allowing seamless integration with your existing ERP, WMS, or customs management systems. Contact our sales team for integration details.

items.q: Is my information and searches kept confidential?
items.a: Absolutely. We take data security seriously. All data is encrypted in transit and at rest, and we never share your search history or business data with third parties. See our Privacy Policy for complete details.

items.q: What's the difference between a regular HS code search and your analysis?
items.a: Unlike basic HS code lookup tools, our analysis provides complete trade intelligence: duties, taxes, regulations, compliance requirements, FTA opportunities, alternative classifications, and confidence scores - all in one comprehensive report.

items.q: Which countries are supported by the system?
items.a: tariff.ai covers 190+ countries and territories, including all major trading nations. Our coverage includes the US, EU member states, UK, China, Japan, and most other countries involved in international trade.
Yes! You can try tariff.ai for free with one complimentary report. This gives you a chance to experience our AI classification and see the value before committing to a paid plan.

items.q: How do I get support for professional questions?
items.a: Our support team is available via email at hello@tariff.ai. Enterprise customers receive priority support with dedicated account managers and faster response times.

cookiePolicy.title: Cookie Policy
cookiePolicy.intro: Understanding how we use cookies and similar technologies on tariff.ai

sections.title: 1. What Are Cookies
sections.content: Cookies are small text files stored on your device (computer, tablet, or mobile phone) when you visit a website. They help websites remember your preferences, understand how you use them, and provide a better user experience.

sections.title: 2. How We Use Cookies
sections.content:
tariff.ai uses cookies for the following purposes:

Essential Functions:
• Maintain your logged-in session
• Remember your language and theme preferences
• Secure your connection to our services

Analytics & Performance:
• Understand which pages are most popular
• Analyze user behavior to improve our service
• Track technical errors and bugs

User Experience:
• Remember your cookie consent preferences
• Personalize content based on your interests
• Optimize site performance

sections.title: 3. Types of Cookies We Use
sections.content:
3.1 Essential Cookies (Always Active)
These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be disabled.
Examples: session_id, csrf_token, auth_state

3.2 Analytics Cookies (Requires Consent)
Help us understand how visitors interact with our website.
Examples: Google Analytics

3.3 Marketing Cookies (Requires Consent)
Used to deliver relevant advertisements and measure campaign effectiveness.
Examples: Facebook Pixel, Google Ads

sections.title: 4. Cookie Duration
sections.content:
Session Cookies (Temporary): These cookies expire when you close your browser.
Persistent Cookies (Long-term): These cookies remain on your device for a specified period (e.g., 12 months for analytics).

sections.title: 5. Cookies We Use - Detailed List
sections.content:
Essential Cookies:
• session_id: User session management (Session, First-party)
• analytics_session_id: Analytics tracking ID (12 months, First-party)
• cookie_consent: Stores consent preferences (1 year, First-party)

Analytics Cookies (with consent):
• Page tracking: Records page views (12 months, First-party)
• Action tracking: Records user interactions (12 months, First-party)
• Session data: Tracks user sessions (30 minutes, First-party)

sections.title: 6. Third-Party Cookies
sections.content:
Currently, tariff.ai minimizes the use of third-party cookies. However, we may use:
• Base44 Platform (Infrastructure Provider)
• Future Third-Party Services (e.g., payment processors)

sections.title: 7. Managing Your Cookie Preferences
sections.content:
7.1 Through Our Cookie Banner: You can customize your preferences when you first visit the site or through the settings.
7.2 Through Your Browser: All modern browsers allow you to control cookies (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge).

sections.title: 8. Disabling Cookies - Impact
sections.content:
If You Disable All Cookies: Cannot stay logged in, settings won't be saved.
If You Disable Only Non-Essential Cookies: Website will function normally, you'll stay logged in, but we won't be able to improve the site based on usage data.

sections.title: 9. Do Not Track (DNT)
sections.content: We honor your cookie consent choices through our banner. DNT signals are not universally standardized.

sections.title: 10. Data Collected Through Cookies
sections.content: Device Information (IP address, Browser type), Usage Information (Pages visited), Technical Information (Language, Timezone).
